basics.name: Ayoub Ajarra
basics.summary: A random human enchanted by the beauty of mathematics, willing to reveal that beauty from complex problems.

work.name: MILA, Université de Montréal
work.position: Visiting research student - Supervised by Yoshua Bengio and Loubna Benabbou
work.summary: Studied the ability of ML models to predict space time evolution of a dynamical system (fluids) with almost no knowledge of a physicist. Developped a new approach based on Helmholtz theorem to reduce the representation -describing Rayleigh-Bénard instability, into a discrete one and study the interaction of the vortices represented by keypoints, then implemented a graph encoder-decoder to learn the space-time evolution of the discrete representation based on causal graphs.
highlights: Space-time evolution,SImulation, Deep learning for scientific discovery, Physical inductive bias, Causal graphs

education.institution: Scool (Previously Sequel) Inria - Université de Lille
education.area: Learning Theory, Fairness, Multi-armed Bandits, Reinforcement Learning theory and Sequential Decision Making
